title: Acts 4: Peter and John Are Arrested
short_title: Acts 4: Peter and John Are Arrested
content: Do you remember how angry the Jewish rulers were when Jesus performed miracles? Imagine how they felt when the Apostles started performing miracles in Jesus’ name. As you read
, look for how bold Peter had become. Also think about why the Jewish rulers were so determined to stop Peter and the other Apostles from bearing witness of Jesus Christ.
—Why Were the Priests and the Sadducees So Upset?

Men such as Annas and Caiaphas were Sadducees, a group that controlled the temple. They did not believe in the Resurrection and did not like Peter teaching about the Resurrection of Christ. They, with other Jewish leaders and the Romans, crucified Christ for His teachings and thought that would be the end of Christianity. The priests, the Sadducees, and many other groups of people were very upset when the Apostles continued teaching the gospel of Jesus Christ.
Do one of the following activities (A–C) as you study
Apostles Arrested for Healing and Teaching
Imagine you were with Peter and John when they healed the lame man (see
). Suppose you had a friend in another city who had not heard about what happened. Write a letter to that friend and try to explain it. Be sure to include the following details:
The age of the lame man who was healed
Why the priests and Sadducees were so upset
The question the high priest asked Peter
What they told Peter and John to do and how the Apostles responded
How you feel about what happened
Peter bore powerful testimony of Jesus Christ even though he knew it might mean he would be put to death. Rewrite
, being careful to keep Peter’s original meaning.
